content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and fast enough for CoC, but very fun

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great game.

Uuhm - is this not basically 'take the second half of the string, put it up front'? Based on the statement my interest was raised, but then the eventual need was a bit disappointing.

How about:
- first part of the string, reverse it one time
- second part of the string, reverse it two times
You could even introduce a variable x: split the string in x parts, and each part i must be reversed i times. Eg x = 5:, with parts i=1 to i=5:
- first part  must be reversed 1 time,
- second part must be reversed 2 times,
...
- fifth part must be reversed 5 times.

Goal section
* It is not clear what to do with the two halves. Please write more clear instructions.

* Please explain what should be done if the length of the given string is odd. In such a case, "first half" and "second half" are not well-defined.

(You may refer to this clash as a reference:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/44277c977ebad04564d3126a32fcc923ee69 )

Input section
* Please delete "of the type abcdef" because the meaning is unclear.

Output section
* Again, unclear meaning (send what? "himself"?). Please just write "the new string generated based on the requirement in the statement".

Constraints section
* Please fix the typo: "lenght" => "length".

* Please state the lower limit of the length.

* Please state a more reasonable upper limit of the length, e.g. 100, instead of 10000. (The longest length of your cases is just 40.)

Cases
* Test 5 and Validator 5 are the same. Please revise them so that they are different.

Thanks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's is a fun game with a logic to have
